sentence: One candidate, Mike Gibbons, has already spent $10 million on an ad campaign that will run through the state’s early May primary.
author: Chris Cillizza
title: More than $100 million in ads has *already* been spent on just 5 Senate races

sentence: Ohio’s crowded Republican Senate primary is still 2 1/2 months away, but one candidate has made gains in recent weeks: businessman Mike Gibbons.
author: Kate Scanlon
title: Mike Gibbons takes lead in Republican race for Ohio seat

sentence: At CPAC a couple of weeks ago, I had the opportunity to interview Ohio US Senate Candidate Mike Gibbons.
author: Scott Hounsell
title: CPAC Interview: Ohio Senate Candidate Mike Gibbons

sentence: Ohio Republican Senate candidate Mike Gibbons on Wednesday rolled out an ad touting his own business experience as the race for the GOP nomination in the state turns ugly.
title: Gibbons rolls out ad touting business experience as Ohio Senate primary turns ugly

sentence: A spokesperson for Gibbons's campaign told TheBlaze that "Mike Gibbons does not support tax increases on any Americans – and never has."
author: Samuel Mangold-Lenett
title: Ohio Senate candidate Mike Gibbons says middle-class Americans don't pay 'any kind of fair share' of income taxes

sentence: x Ohio GOP Senate candidate Mike Gibbons on a Crain’s Cleveland Business podcast: “The top 20% of earners in the U.S. pay 82% of federal income tax — and, you do the math, and 45% to 50% don’t pay any income tax… The middle class is not really paying any kind of a fair share.” pic.twitter.com/VUYzPTlqmX — Heartland Signal (@HeartlandSignal) April 8, 2022 This is a short blurb about Daily Kos.
title: Ohio GOP Senate hopeful: Middle class isn't paying its fair share

sentence: Senate hopeful Mike Gibbons — by some measures, the frontrunner in Ohio’s GOP primary — pledged yesterday that he will not support new taxes if elected.
author: Steve Benen
title: Ohio Republican: Middle class doesn’t pay ‘fair share’ in taxes
